# Introduction to R {#ch2_introduction}

## What is R?

R is a programming language and open-source software environment primarily used for statistical computing and data analysis. It was created by [Ross Ihaka](https://www.stat.auckland.ac.nz/~ihaka/?Ross_Ihaka) and [Robert Gentleman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Gentleman_(statistician)) at the University of Auckland, New Zealand, in the early 1990s. R is known for its powerful data manipulation and statistical analysis capabilities, making it a popular choice among statisticians, data scientists, and researchers for tasks such as data exploration, visualization, modeling, and hypothesis testing.
